member.name: T:Avalonia.Markup.Data.DelayedBinding
member.summary: Provides delayed bindings for controls.
member.remarks: The XAML engine applies its bindings in a delayed manner where bindings are only applied when a control has finished initializing. This is done because applying bindings as soon as controls are created means that long-form bindings (i.e. bindings that don't use the `{Binding}` markup extension but instead use `<Binding>`) don't work, as the binding is applied to the property before the properties on the `Binding` object are set. Looking at WPF it uses a similar mechanism for bindings that come from XAML.

member.name: M:Avalonia.Markup.Data.DelayedBinding.Add(Avalonia.StyledElement,Avalonia.AvaloniaProperty,Avalonia.Data.IBinding)
member.summary: Adds a delayed binding to a control.
member.param: The property on the control to bind to.

member.name: M:Avalonia.Markup.Data.DelayedBinding.Add(Avalonia.StyledElement,System.Reflection.PropertyInfo,System.Func{Avalonia.StyledElement,System.Object})
member.summary: Adds a delayed value to a control.
member.param: The property on the control to bind to.
A function which returns the value.

member.name: M:Avalonia.Markup.Data.DelayedBinding.ApplyBindings(Avalonia.StyledElement)
member.summary: Applies any delayed bindings to a control.
